title: Orion doubles money on $52 million Swann House sale
text:
Swann House in central Melbourne has more than doubled in value for owner Orion International Group after being sold for $52 million to a buyer represented by Swiss-based asset and fund manager Fidinam Group.

The 12-storey art deco-style building - one of the Victorian capital's most distinctive - sold above the price guide of $45 million and on a yield of about 2.5 per cent, reflecting the vacancy rate and the scope to raise rents on existing tenants after a refurbishment, market sources said.

22 William Street in Melbourne. Supplied

Orion purchased the building for $21.6 million in August 2014 on a yield of 6.2 per cent.

Colliers International agent Daniel Wolman, who marketed the building with colleagues Oliver Hay, David Sia and Matt Stagg, in conjunction with CBRE's Josh Rutman, Lewis Tong and Mark Wizel confirmed the sale but declined to comment on the price.

"It has sold to Fidinam, a strong office buyer looking to add value, and capitalise on a strong office market in a strong Melbourne market," Mr Wolman said.
description: Swiss fund manager Fidinam buys boutique B-grade building for European institution.
